title-group.article-title: A Continuity Property of Multivariate Lagrange Interpolation

abstract.p: Let {S<sub>t</sub>} be a sequence of interpolation schemes in R<sup>n</sup> of degree d (i.e. for each S<sup>t</sup> one has unique interpolation by a polynomial of total degree ≤ d) and total order ≤ l. Suppose that the points of S<sub>t</sub> tend to 0 ∈ R<sup>n</sup> as t → ∞ and the Lagrange-Hermite interpolants, H<sub>S<sub>t</sub></sub>, satisfy <tex-math>$\lim_{t \rightarrow \infty} H_{S_t} (x^\alpha) = 0$</tex-math> for all monomials x<sup>α</sup> with |α| = d + 1. Theorem <tex-math>$\lim_{t \rightarrow \infty} H_{S_t} (f) = T^d (f)$</tex-math> for all functions f of class C<sup>l - 1</sup> in a neighborhood of O. (Here T<sup>d</sup> (f) denotes the Taylor series of f at 0 to order d.) Specific examples are given to show the optimality of this result.
